I hear ya

________________________________

From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com =
[mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Marlboro63@...
Sent: Tues=
day, August 12, 2008 2:08 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] THe Ovilus



Debbie,
 
I completely understand what you mean.  I did =
work with another group
but was not committed to them.  And later people go=
t in a pissing match
about me.  In a statement about me it was said to some=
one...."why are
you talking to MY PEOPLE".  And I just said excuse me, who =
am I?  i am
use to working together as a group and not being used and that =
is what
happened, I was USED.  And I will never put myself in that position=

again.  I feel that the information I get on an investigation should be
pu=
blic for all to see and hear.  And not be privately used for someone
else's=
 selfish agenda.
 
Jeff
 
In a message dated 8/12/2008 1:00:55 P.M. Central=
 Standard Time,
debbie.fransen@... writes:

	

	
	turst me you two ar=
e better off alone. Groups are interesting
and fun sometimes,
	but there is=
 too much drama......

________________________________

	From: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com]
On Behalf Of Marlboro63@aol.c=
om
	Sent: Tuesday, August 12, 2008 1:59 PM
	To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
	Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] THe Ovilus
	
	

	
	I am not in any group per say.  I j=
ust go out with my friends
and have fun doing what we do.  I have some VERY=
 good friends on here
that I consider family and we exchange information on=
 a daily basis.
When I get my website up and running I will be forming a 4-=
5 person
investigative team.  But until then its just my wife and I enjoy g=
oing
out and having fun talking with the deceased ........:)
	 
	Jeff
	 
	I=
n a message dated 8/12/2008 12:46:54 P.M. Central Standard
Time, debbie.fra=
nsen@... writes:

		

		
		Jeff,
		What group are you in? 
		 

_____=
___________________________

		From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Marlboro63@...

12, 2008 1:44 PM

 Ovilus
		
		

		
		Elabeth,
		 
		I have A LOT OF TOYS at this time.  Whic=
h I am sure a
lot of other paranormal investigators have as well.  I am not=
 selling
this unit because it does not work but because it does work and I =
have
lots of other toys and boxes that work as well.  I also have a few oth=
er
boxes that I will be selling and maybe listing on Ebay as well.  And I
j=
ust recently went on an investigation at Eastern State Penn and I had
so mu=
ch equipment there and not enough hands or body to carry it, LOL.
So I do n=
ot want to put myself in that position oagain.
		 
		Jeff
		 
		In a messag=
e dated 8/12/2008 11:43:19 A.M. Central
Standard Time, elabeth@... wr=
ites:

			

			I'll ask some local ghost hunters I know if
they'd be intere=
sted and
			pass along your email addy. If you get great
responses then why=
 sell
			it? I know they're gonna ask. haha I'd keep the
toys that work wel=
l.
			I'm sure the editing did cut out some waiting
around etc., and I
			h=
aven't read Ryan's blog about the episode yet.
He will usually say
			somet=
hing about it there if the editing is done
to make something seem
			more t=
han what it was and I've seen him express
concern about
			production thing=
s there before, so I think he'll
mention it if the
			footage was heavily e=
dited.
			
			~Elabeth
			
			On Tue, Aug 12, 2008 at 11:29 AM,
<Marlboro63=
@... <mailto:Marlboro63%40aol.com> > wrote:
			> Hi Elabeth,
			>
			> =
You have to remember much of what the Ovilus 1
said probably ended up on th=
e
			> editing room floor. But it does work. I get
great responses from min=
e.
			> The (7) different modes on it work very well.
But if you know anyon=
e who
			> wants one please let me know. I was informed I
have to sell some=
 of my toys
			> to afford to buy new toys...LOLOL I would sell
it for $165=
.00 and it is in
			> brand new condition and only used a few times.
			>
	=
		> Jeff
			>
			> In a message dated 8/12/2008 11:24:20 A.M.
Central Stand=
ard Time,
			> elabeth@... <mailto:elabeth%40gmail.com>
writes:
			>
=
			> I thought it was pretty neat that it repeated
the word "worry" when
		=
	> Ryan asked if it was worried they'd bring in a
priest.
			> What are the=
 odds of that just based on
environmental readings? If I
			> had an extra =
$200 laying around I'd be buying
myself one to play with.
			> ~Elabeth
			=
>
			> On Tue, Aug 12, 2008 at 7:41 AM, Fransen,
Debbie
			> <debbie.franse=
n@...
<mailto:debbie.fransen%40delta.com> > wrote:
			>> I don't know=
 how many of the members watch
Paranormal State, but they used
			>> a new =
piece of equipment called The Ovilus.
You guys have got to check
			>> this=

			>> out. Go to www.digitaldowsing.com. I am not
really sure who these gu=
ys
			>> are,
			>> and
			>> where they came up with this. To me, it
sound=
s kind of like Frank's Box,
			>> but
			>> not the same.
			>> Frank, plea=
se take a look at this, and tell
us what you think.
			>> I don't understan=
d how it works......
			>> Deb
